There are very little faults about HL2, but meny aspects of HL2 are all fantastic. The original HL revolutionized both technological advancements and story telling, using no cutscenes or third person view. That all continued in HL2 with even better graphics thanks to the Source engine, better storyline, and fantastic characters such as Gordon Freeman, Alxy Vance, and of course, the G-Man. HL2 looks like a brand-new game even after nearly 12 years since its release, and that's a testament to Valve's ability to bring such a damn perfect game.
P.S. HL3 needs to be even more perfect. I want to believe.

Одна из самых гениальных и впечатляющих игр, когда-либо созданных. 
Впервые я её прошел 10 лет назад и до сих пор восхищаюсь. Жаль, что продолжения не будет.

+Физика и интерактивность. С 2004 года никто лучше не сделал, только Монолит в F.E.A.R. сравнился
+Графика. Half-Life 2 (и Dishonored) всегда отличал особый, уникальный стиль дизайнера Виктора Антонова. Аналогов реально не существует.
+Звук и музыка. Кейли Бейли, композитор Half-Life 1 и 2, написал завораживающий эмбиент и мощные боевые композиции.
+Сюжет и мир. Они очень хорошо проработаны и производят впечатление цельного произведения. А тема одна - путешествие соло.
Мне бессмысленно объяснять - игра просто крутая. Если вам умные сюжетные шутеры нравятся, и вы каким-то чудом не играли - смело покупайте.
Но учтите, посмотрите сначала пару стримов - геймплей не всех устраивает. Находятся критики, которым игра жутко не понравилась. Но они в абсолютном меньшинстве.

Disclaimer: I am writing this from a modern day perspective.  This is the first time I have played it and I do not have any nostalgia associated with this game.  Therefore I will be very frank in regards to this game.

Pros:
-fun vehicle sections
-physics puzzles
-The coast
-extremely well optimized (199 fps!)

Cons:
-dated gunplay (no ironsights???)
-frequent loading screens between sections breaks immersion
-disjointed gameworld (doesn't feel real)
-life less characters that I coudn't bring myself to care about
-less groundbreaking than HL1
-Gordon Freeman is NOT an interesting character at all, just an empty shell
-unpolished even for 2004

Conclusion:  HL2 truly hasn't aged well.  HL1 was far more revolutionary and I just can't see why people hold HL2 in such high regard from a modern perspective.  Let the downvotes begin, and no downvotes are not for those that disagree with my opinion.  6/10

I first played the original Half Life shortly after release. The hype is real. Yes even in 2016. The Half Life series in my eyes is one of the best FPS games on the planet. Everything about it is epic. The storyline, voices, enemies. Everything!! I am not a hardcore gamer by anymeans, but this would have to be my favourite series by far. Well done Valve. Please continue the Half Life series!!!!

Once I got money on Steam for the first time, I decided to get Half LIfe and Portal games. I wasn't expecting much, but then when I played them, I was just ultamitely shocked at how great they were. This game is brilliant. I've seen graphics before this game, and this game was just a huge jump forward. One big step for Gamers, one big leap for Gamer kind. The game combines great story and gameplay just as Half Life did. The only thing I didn't like about this game, is I found it too easy compared to the first one. Another thing is the lack of horror. There is one part of the game with horror and great difficulty, but I won't spoil this game. I highly recommend it. 9/10
